sen.j: 葛木坐火雷神社（かつらきいますほのいかづちじんじゃ）は、奈良県葛城市笛吹（旧新庄町笛吹）にある神社である。
sen.e: Katsuraki Imasu Hono Ikazuchi-jinja Shrineis a shrine located in Fuefuki, Katsuraki City (former Fuefuki, Shinjo-cho), Nara Prefecture.
The Katsuraki Imasu Hono Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Fuefuki, Katsuraki City (former Fuefuki, Shinjo-cho), Nara Prefecture.
The Katsuraki Imasu Hono Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Fuefuki, Katsuraki City (former Fuefuki, Shinjo-cho), Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 式内社（名神大社）で、旧社格は郷社。
sen.e: It is a Shikinaisha (one of the shrines listed in the Register of Deities) and Myojin Taisha (a shrine dedicated to a famed deity), which was ranked Gosha (Rural District Shrine) in the Meiji Period.

It is a Shikinaisha (one of the shrines listed in the Register of Deities) and Myojin Taisha (a shrine dedicated to a famed deity), which was ranked as a Gosha (Rural District Shrine) in the Meiji Period.

It is a Shikinaisha (one of the shrines listed in the Register of Deities) and Myojin Taisha (a shrine dedicated to a famed deity), which was ranked as a Gosha (Rural District Shrine) in the Meiji Period.
It is commonly called Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.
It is commonly called Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.
It is commonly called Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.
Deities Enshrined
Enshrined Deities
Enshrined Deities

sen.j: 火雷大神と天香山命を主祭神とし、天照大神・タカミムスビ・ニニギ・伊古比都幣命を配祀する。
sen.e: The main deity of this shrine is Hono-Ikazuchi-no-O-Kami. Amaterasu-no-O-Mi-Kami, Takamimusubi, Ninigi-no-Mikoto and Ikohitobe-no-Mikoto are enshrined as joint tutelars.
The main deity of the shrine is Hono-Ikazuchi-no-O-Kami, while Amaterasu-no-O-Mi-Kami, Takamimusubi, Ninigi-no-Mikoto and Ikohitobe-no-Mikoto are enshrined as joint tutelars.
The main deity of the shrine is Hono-Ikazuchi-no-O-Kami, while Amaterasu-no-O-Mi-Kami, Takamimusubi, Ninigi-no-Mikoto and Ikohitobe-no-Mikoto are enshrined as joint tutelars.

sen.j: 葛木坐火雷神社の元々の祭神は火雷大神で、天香山命は笛吹神社の祭神である。
sen.e: The deity originally enshrined at Katsuraki Imasu Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine was Hono-Ikazuchi-no-O-Kami; Ame-no-Kaguyama-no-Mikoto was the deity enshrined at Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.
The deity originally enshrined at Katsuraki Imasu Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine was Hono-Ikazuchi-no-O-Kami, and Ame-no-Kaguyama-no-Mikoto was the deity enshrined at Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.
The deity originally enshrined at Katsuraki Imasu Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine was Hono-Ikazuchi-no-O-Kami, and Ame-no-Kaguyama-no-Mikoto was the deity enshrined at Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.
Hisory
Hisory
Hisory

sen.j: 創建の年代は不詳であるが、社伝では神代とも神武天皇の御代とも伝える。
sen.e: The year of the foundation is unidentified: Shinto tradition says it should have been around 600 B.C. or even before.
The time in which the shrine was founded is unknown but Shrine legend tells that it was established during the reign of Emperor Jinmu.
The time in which the shrine was founded is unknown but Shrine legend tells that it was established during the reign of Emperor Jinmu.

sen.j: 文献の初出は『文徳天皇実録』の仁寿2年（852年）4月、正三位の神階を授けるという記述である。
sen.e: The first record on this shrine is seen in Montoku Tenno Jitsuroku (The True History of Emperor Montoku of Japan), in which this shrine is said to have been ranked fifth in Shinto ranking in April in 852.

The first written reference to the shrine appears in "Montoku Tenno Jitsuroku" (The True History of Emperor Montoku of Japan), which states that the shrine was granted the Senior Third Rank on April in 852.

The first written reference to the shrine appears in "Montoku Tenno Jitsuroku" (The True History of Emperor Montoku of Japan), which states that the shrine was granted the Senior Third Rank on April in 852.

sen.j: 『日本三代実録』によれば貞観 (日本)元年（859年）正月27日に従二位の神階を授けられた。
sen.e: According to ''Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku (The True History of Three Reigns of Japan), this shrine was ranked fourth in Shinto ranking on January 27 in 859.
According to "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (The True History of Three Reigns of Japan), the shrine was awarded the Junior Second Rank on January 27 in 859.
According to "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (The True History of Three Reigns of Japan), the shrine was awarded the Junior Second Rank on January 27 in 859.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では「大和国忍海郡 葛木坐火雷神社二座」と記載され、名神大社に列し、月次・相嘗・新嘗の弊帛に預ると記されている。
sen.e: InEngishiki Jinmyocho, a formal record on shrines, it was described as ''upper and lowerKatsuraki Imasu Hono Ikazuchi-jinja Shrines in Oshimi-no-Kori or Oshimi-gun in Yamato Province,'' belonging to Myojin Taisha (shrines dedicated to a famed deity), and they were to receive offerings at Tsukiji, Ainae, Niiname Ceremonies.

The Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of shrines) describes the shrine as 'upper and lower Katsuraki Imasu Hono Ikazuchi-jinja Shrines in Oshimi-no-Kori or Oshimi-gun in Yamato Province,' ranks it as a Myojin Taisha (shrine dedicated to a famed deity), states that it receives offerings at the Tsukiji, Ainae, Niiname Ceremonies.

The Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of shrines) describes the shrine as 'upper and lower Katsuraki Imasu Hono Ikazuchi-jinja Shrines in Oshimi-no-Kori or Oshimi-gun in Yamato Province,' ranks it as a Myojin Taisha (shrine dedicated to a famed deity), states that it receives offerings at the Tsukinami, Ainame, Niiname Ceremonies.

sen.j: しかし、これ以降、葛木坐火雷神社についての記述は見られなくなる。
sen.e: After this, however, no record on this shrine has been found.
After this, however, no record on this shrine has been found.
After this, however, no record on this shrine has been found.

sen.j: 社伝では、平安時代に社勢が衰え、当地にあった笛吹神社の末社になったと伝える。
sen.e: According to Shinto tradition, the power of the shrine declined during the Heian period, and it is said to have become the auxiliary shrine of Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.
According to Shinto tradition, the power of the shrine declined during the Heian period, and it is said to have become the auxiliary shrine of Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.
According to Shinto tradition, the power of the shrine declined during the Heian Period, and it is said to have become the auxiliary shrine of Fuefuki-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 笛吹神社は、当地を拠点とした笛吹連によって作られた神社とみられる。
sen.e: Fuefuki-jinja Shrine is considered to have been founded by Fuefuki Muraji (muraji: an ancient hereditary title), who had thier bases in this district.
Fuefuki-jinja Shrine is considered to have been founded by Fuefuki Muraji (muraji: an ancient hereditary title) based in the area.
Fuefuki-jinja Shrine is considered to have been founded by Fuefuki Muraji (muraji: an ancient hereditary title) based in the area.

sen.j: 祭神の天香山命は笛吹連の祖神である。
sen.e: The deity enshrined, Ame-no-Kaguyama-no-Mikoto, was the ancestral deity of Fuefuki Muraji.
The enshrined deity, Ame-no-Kaguyama-no-Mikoto, was the ancestral deity of Fuefuki Muraji.
The enshrined deity, Ame-no-Kaguyama-no-Mikoto, was the ancestral deity of Fuefuki Muraji.

sen.j: 本殿の背後に古墳があり、笛吹連の祖・櫂子の父である建多析命の墓であると伝えられている。
sen.e: Behind the main hall (Honden) is a burial mound which is said to be the grave of Taketasaku-no-Mikoto, the father of Kajiko (the ancestor of Fuefuki Muraji).
Behind the main hall (honden) is a burial mound which is said to be the grave of Taketasaku-no-Mikoto, the father of Kajiko (the ancestor of Fuefuki Muraji).
Behind the main hall (honden) is a burial mound which is said to be the grave of Taketasaku-no-Mikoto, the father of Kajiko (the ancestor of Fuefuki Muraji).

sen.j: 1874年（明治7年）、笛吹神社の末社であった火雷社を笛吹神社に合祀し、社名を葛木坐火雷神社に改め、郷社に列格した。
sen.e: In 1874, Honoikazuchi-jinja shrine, which had been the auxiliary shrine of Fuefuki-jinja Shrine, was enshrined along with Fuefuki-jinja Shrine, and the name of the shrine was changed to Katsuraki Imasu Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine, ranking itself Gosha.

In 1874, Honoikazuchi-jinja shrine, which had been the auxiliary shrine of Fuefuki-jinja Shrine, was enshrined along with Fuefuki-jinja Shrine, and the name of the shrine was changed to Katsuraki Imasu Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine, becoming ranked as a Gosha.
sen.cmt: ranking itself > becoming ranked as a Gosha
sen.e: In 1874, Honoikazuchi-jinja shrine, which had been the auxiliary shrine of Fuefuki-jinja Shrine, was enshrined along with Fuefuki-jinja Shrine, and the name of the shrine was changed to Katsuraki Imasu Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine, becoming ranked as a Gosha.
